column5: Hi all,  Well I like some snow, JUST NOT ALL AT ONCE!
Very nice Simon. A winter wonderland in your back yard. Enjoy!

Great pictures they look B&W with hints of colour; the one of the dog especially. Only in Canada EH; I went to the drive-in theater Saturday night in the 50 Chev; it was more like May then November. As nice as those pictures are you can keep all that snow. LOL  Dan.

Keep it, that is more snow than we have got in any of the last five years since I've retired and bought a snowblower. One winter never even used it and that don't bother me.  If I do venture out it is for the open water of the Niagara River for the next few months.
One of my favorite times to take photos, just after a big snow storm.
So, did you cast it off in our direction?
Nope, he cast it in my direction lol. Been plowing since last night
Very nice Simon, but please keep it up there for a bit longer. I am no where near ready for that yet! In fact, I don't know if I'm ever going to be ready for it! lol

Very nice Simon, but please keep it up there for a bit longer. I am no where near ready for that yet! In fact, I don't know if I'm ever going to be ready for it! lol  X2.  I have a couple more boating trips planned that I'm hoping to get in.  Mind you, ripping around on the sled is a lot of fun as well.
Send it my way!!!! We have ice now, but no snow to get there on. Trailering sucks when you can usually just ride from your door.
very nice .... send it this way we gotta have it for Christmas ...

Keep it, that is more snow than we have got in any of the last five years since I've retired and bought a snowblower. One winter never even used it and that don't bother me.  If I do venture out it is for the open water of the Niagara River for the next few months.  Both Dave's in Grimsby agree!
I cut the grass yesterday I was nice enough to take a video to send to my brother in northern Saskatchewan. He is going to make me one with his snowblower lol
